sn56.18:2.1: 2 Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma
sn56.18:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
sn56.18:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn56.18:4.4: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘knowledge’.
sn56.18:4.6: And how is an knowledgeable person defined?”
sn56.18:4.7: “Knowing about suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn56.18:4.9: And this is how an knowledgeable person is defined.
sn56.18:5.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
